definition: to work to no avail (idiom)
disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence
surname Tu
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)

sentences.english: The wind cannot be caught in a net.
All our efforts availed us little in trying to effect a change.
sentences.chinese: 在企图实现一个变革中我们徒劳无功。

sentences.english: We wasted all day on a wild-goose chase.
sentences.chinese: 我们徒劳无功的浪费了一整天。

sentences.english: All the entreating of the coast guard was in vain.
sentences.chinese: 海岸警卫队的队员，无论怎样劝说都徒劳无功。

sentences.english: This would be as futile as trying to tame a volcano.
sentences.chinese: 这样做无疑像要驯服火山一样徒劳无功。

sentences.english: So I started looking online, also in vain.
sentences.chinese: 所以我开始在网上查找，也是徒劳无功。

sentences.english: But the two-toed tree toad tried in vain.
sentences.chinese: 可是，二趾蟾蜍徒劳无功。

sentences.english: Wild-goose chases may happen sometimes during an investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在一项调查的过程中，有时也许产生徒劳无功的结果。

sentences.english: The wind cannot be caught in net.
Change for change's sake is stupid and enervating.
sentences.chinese: 为改变而改变是愚蠢而徒劳无功的。

sentences.english: But the dramatic scenes of hired workers washing oil off beaches turned out to be images of futility.
sentences.chinese: 但工人们在沙滩上冲洗油污的结果却是徒劳无功。

sentences.english: I made many attempts, all in vain.
sentences.chinese: 我尝试了多次，都徒劳无功。

sentences.english: It is in vain, sir, extenuate the matter.
sentences.chinese: 先生，企图使事态减轻是徒劳无功的。

sentences.english: It is aimless to cast water into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 投杯水于大海，徒劳无功。

sentences.english: The caged bird flapped its wings in a vain attempt to fly away.
sentences.chinese: 笼子哩的鸟拍打着翅膀想飞走，但却徒劳无功。

definition: futile
futile endeavor (idiom)
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
to no avail/of no use
unhelpful/useless
to return without any achievement (idiom); to go home with one's tail between one's legs
to no avail/achieving nothing/totally ineffective/to have no effect/to fall flat (esp. of joke or speech that is completely ignored)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
in vain/to no avail
useless/worthless
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to fail to grasp the main points
pointless/meaningless/unnecessarily
